M12/3/PSYCH/BP1/ENG/TZ1/XX




     22125702

PSYCHOLOGY
HIGHER LEVEL and standard LEVEL
PAPER 1

Wednesday 2 May 2012 (afternoon)

2 hours


INSTRUCTIONS to candidates

   Do not turn over this examination paper until instructed to do so.
   Section A: answer all the questions.
   Section B: answer one question.
   The maximum mark for this examination paper is [46 marks].




2212-5702                                                                                             2 pages
                                                              © International Baccalaureate Organization 2012
                                                    –2–                  M12/3/PSYCH/BP1/ENG/TZ1/XX

                                               SECTION A

Answer all questions in this section. Marks will be awarded for focused answers demonstrating accurate
knowledge and understanding of research.

Biological level of analysis

1.    Describe one principle that defines the biological level of analysis.                      [8 marks]


Cognitive level of analysis

2.    Describe one ethical consideration related to one research study at the cognitive level
      of analysis.                                                                               [8 marks]


Sociocultural level of analysis

3.    Explain why one particular research method has been used at the sociocultural level
      of analysis.                                                                               [8 marks]




                                               SECTION B

Answer one question in this section. Marks will be awarded for demonstration of knowledge and
understanding (which requires the use of relevant psychological research), evidence of critical thinking
(e.g. application, analysis, synthesis, evaluation), and organization of answers.

4.    Discuss one evolutionary explanation of one behaviour.                                    [22 marks]


5.    Evaluate two models or theories of one cognitive process.                                 [22 marks]


6.    Discuss the use of two compliance techniques.                                             [22 marks]




2212-5702
